cluster_relations.rel_desc: Mirroring another person's posture is a specific posture-related behavior.
remarks: Modeled as a posture-related nonverbal cue.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Standing up straight with shoulders back is a specific kind of posture.
cluster_relations.subject_entity_name: standing up straight with shoulders back

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Slouching is characterized as a particular posture.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a more specific subtype or variant within the broader category represented by the object.
args.justification: All three relations describe a specific posture-related behavior or stance (subject) as a particular kind or type of the broader category 'posture' (object). This matches a hierarchical subtype (taxonomy) relation, so they should share the canonical predicate 'is_subtype_of'.

Each relation organizes a specific nonverbal or posture cue as a member of a broader posture category, which is a classic hierarchical taxonomy (type-of) structure. Grouping them under 'hierarchical_taxonomy_relation' captures this class-level semantics.

Type-of / subtype relations express categorical identity between a specific instance or subtype and a broader class, placing them under a broad group that covers class-membership and identity-like taxonomic links.
